title: PyTorch AMD
body_html:
1. CUDA implies static for global symbols with __forceinline__. However, HCC does not. Thus, static keywords are required in order to avoid multiple symbols.

  2. Now using the KMTHINLTO optimization to allow for fasting linking of ROCm builds.

  3. HIP CMake forgets the compile definitions of the CMake directory. Adding them back.

  4. Moved pyHIPIFY into the PyTorch repository.
body_text:
CUDA implies static for global symbols with __forceinline__. However, HCC does not. Thus, static keywords are required in order to avoid multiple symbols.


Now using the KMTHINLTO optimization to allow for fasting linking of ROCm builds.


HIP CMake forgets the compile definitions of the CMake directory. Adding them back.


Moved pyHIPIFY into the PyTorch repository.
body:
1) CUDA implies static for global symbols with \_\_forceinline\_\_. However, HCC does not. Thus, static keywords are required in order to avoid multiple symbols.

2) Now using the KMTHINLTO optimization to allow for fasting linking of ROCm builds.

3) HIP CMake forgets the compile definitions of the CMake directory. Adding them back.

4) Moved pyHIPIFY into the PyTorch repository.
